description.plain:
Casyo “Krept” Johnson and Karl “Konan” Wilson are a British rap duo. Their mixtape Young Kingz was a huge chart success considering that it was unsigned, and their street single “Don’t Waste My Time” went viral in January 2014. Artists to remix the track include French Montana, Wretch 32, Chip and Stormzy.

Their debut album The Long Way Home was released in 2015, preceded by the singles “Certified” (feat. Rick Ross) and the chart hit “Freak of the Week” (feat. Jeremih).

description.plain:
“Freak of the Week” is the first official single from Krept & Konan’s debut album The Long Way Home, following the release of the street single “Certified”.

The song sees them team up with American R&B star Jeremih, who they previously linked up with for the UK version of his song “Don’t Tell Em”.

Samples https://genius.com/Beenie-man-who-am-i-lyrics

songs.full_title: Don't Waste My Time by Krept & Konan
songs.title: Don’t Waste My Time

description.plain:
This monster UK Rap hit originates from an independently released mixtape entitled
‘Young Kingz’ by Play Dirty duo Krept & Konan.

When Young Kingz was released on Sept 2nd 2013, it immediately stormed up the iTunes charts scoring No1 on the hip-hop charts and No10 overall. The official YouTube video has already gained over 1 million views and counting.

Don’t Waste My Time is produced by UK based producer AdotSkitz.

It gained prominence when the track was remixed by French Montana on his Coke Boys 4 mixtape featuring Chinx Drugz and Lil Durk.

The official UK remix features US Rappers
French Montana and Chinx Drugs. As well as
UK Rappers in the form of Chip, Wretch 32 and Fekky.

Don’t Waste My Time is produced by UK based producer AdotSkitz.

It gained prominence when the track was remixed by French Montana on his Coke Boys 4 mixtape featuring Chinx Drugz and Lil Durk.

The official UK remix features French Montana and Chinx Drugs from the US as well as UK rappers in the form of Chip, Wretch 32 and Fekky.

songs.full_title: Ask Flipz by Krept & Konan (Ft. Stormzy)
songs.title: Ask Flipz

description.plain: Krept & Konan kick off their 7 Days album release by posting a music video for a soon-to-be chart-topper featuring Stormzy. The trio carry on with key parts of their word play. Most notably, the song is named ‘Ask Flipz’, which has been referenced in songs by Stormzy multiple times. Konan also tries his hand at Stormzy’s popular phrase beginning with the line “I was on the road when…”, this time paying dues to Ghetts‘ track ’Sing For Me‘.

description.plain: In this song, Konan reminisces about a sad moment in his life when his stepdad Carlton Ned died. This song also tells us about how the two rappers were aided in their careers and how their success started

body.plain: In this song, Konan reminisces about a sad moment in his life when his stepdad Carlton Ned died. This song also tells us about how the two rappers were aided in their careers and how their success started

songs.lyrics:
My Story LyricsWhat the fuck's going on?
Hold the door
Hold the door

[Intro: Konan]
This is my story (Story)
This is my story

[Verse 1: Konan]
Came from radio, it was late
Left the car, went straight to my gate
Head straight
Didn't even look left
Got my key out, started hearing footsteps
Right over my shoulder
Had to act fast, I can hear them getting closer
Tryna' keep calm and put my key into the door
Thinking to myself if I don't make it then it's over
I don't know how I managed it
Ran into my mum's room panicking
Mum shouting at me “Karl what's happening?”
Carl shouting at me “Karl what's happening?”
How the hell did I get in this?
Tryna' hold the door but it's coming off the hinges
Somebody wake me from this dream now
Then I hear a gunshot and my mum scream out
Somebody come and save the day
Somebody take this pain away
How can I ask God for help now, when I ain't even prayed today?
Is this how my life ends? (Nowhere to run, no place to hide in)
Carl ran out of the room tryna' fight them
Two more gunshots, everything's silent
Mum ran downstairs, she's crying
And I can't move a muscle but I'm trying
Praying for an ambulance but I can't hear a siren
She said he's shot I hope she's lying
I hear her shouting out for help, I think he's dying
I'm thinking why him? Was it wrong place, wrong timing?
I see him at the bottom of the stairs
Mum shaking while the neighbors' tryna' save him, heart racing, wishing I could disappear
And it shoulda been me but it's him lying there
And I know it isn't fair
I phone Skanks, phone Shook, my whole body's in shock, I couldn't even shed a tear
Trapped in this nightmare, how did I get here?
[Hook: Konan]
This is my story
All the pain, all the things, falling on me
All the blood, sweat and tears but don't worry
Flashing lights, seen my life flash before me
This is my story
This is my story

[Verse 2: Krept]
Woke up to a ping on my blackberry
It was a message from Kone saying “Somebody tried to kill me and got my family”
I rubbed my eyes, is this a dream or reality?
Kone said, “Krept who the fuck was this mad at me?”
God, how we gon' solve this catastrophe?
Then God gave us 'Otis' it was a blessing from him
Cos it stopped us from going getting reckless on him
Thinking to quit music
Thinking to go and do something stupid
Then things fell in place and started improving
That's why I say the music chose us, we didn't choose it
Bearing in mind Kone started from scratch
Feds took his house, money, clothes, he never had jack
Then I got a call from Vash
He told us the plan so we got up in the lab
Then things started to pick up even more
Skepta hollered at me, said that we should come on tour
Skepta don't even realize what he did for us
Well if you're listening, thank you for help fixing us
From the tour, all these shows start coming in
Back on our feet now the money started flooding in
Invested in clothes and money started doubling
Now so much for struggling
Watching Kones getting back up on his feet
Thinking “How's he coping?”, I couldn't if it was me
Now Play Dirty's on the up fucking up the streets
Every day a new city that we reach
But even though we turned around a mess
I'm sitting in my yard thinking that I could be next
Thinking “Did I give anyone his address?”
That shit that happened to Kone still playing in my head
Thinking 'bout the day it happened, when I saw his mum
And she told me “Please look after my son”
Not a single tear on her face showing
Even though I know her heart's broken
Staying strong even though we're stressing
Cos she lost her husband and that being the second
That's why the music is a must to us
Kone he's going to make it up to her
You might also like[Hook]
This is my story
All the pain, all the things, falling on me
All the blood, sweat and tears but don't worry
Flashing lights, seen my life flash before me
This is my story

songs.full_title: Wo Wo Wo by Krept & Konan
songs.title: Wo Wo Wo

description.plain:
“Wo Wo Wo” serves as the third track of the duo’s mixtape 7 Days. This song is particularly prevalent due to Drake’s contribution as the song begins. Drake’s recognition of the British rappers' work bagged them both an opportunity of performing on Drake’s “Boy Meets World” tour where they played “Don’t Waste My Time”.

Krept & Konan discussed the comments under the music video for this song in a video with Noisey.

When speaking to Capital XTRA, the duo said:

I was literally looking on YouTube and I come across this video of Drake […] I put [the clip at the start of the song] and then I played it to Konan and he was like, “This is hard!” I text Drake and asked him, “Yo, can we do this?” And he was like, “Of course bro”.

songs.title: Crepes And Cones (Ya Dun Know)
songs.title_with_featured: Crepes And Cones (Ya Dun Know) (Ft. MoStack)

description.plain:
Released on 10 May 2018, ‘Crepes And Cones’ is a song by South London rap duo Krept & Konan. It is a promotional single that was teased a week prior in the lead up to Krept & Konan’s new restaurant-dessert bar, Crepes and Cones in Croydon. Steel Banglez is recruited for production and MoStack is brought along too.

In 2014, Krept presented his and Konan’s idea of having a restaurant called “Crepes and Cones”, which they planned since that tweet where the restaurant is now open for business.
